New-York Historical Society
New-York Historical Society collection of certificates
New-York Historical Society
PR 014
9.66 Linear feet in 9 boxes, 8 drawers of flat files
1700-1991 The New-York Historical Society Collection of Certificates (formerly known as the Certificate File) contains certificates from private and civic societies, clubs, and organizations. Diplomas, certificates of merit and various financial and legal documents are also included. The collection contains fine examples of engravings, lithographs, and typography.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers by appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in library for details.
Use Restrictions
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to:
Department of Rights and Reproductions The New-York Historical Society 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194 rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org 212-485-9228
Permission to reproduce or quote text from this collection in a publication must be requested from and granted in writing by the Library Director, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194.
Acquisition Note
The collection is made up of multiple purchases and gifts acquired over time.
Preferred Citation Note
This collection should be cited as the New-York Historical Collection of Certificates, PR 014, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information Note
Processed by Kelly McAnnaney, 2008. Revised by Marybeth Kavanagh, 2018.
Scope and Contents Note
The New-York Historical Society Collection of Certificates (formerly known as the Certificate File) spans the period from 1700 to 1991 and contains certificates issued by a wide variey of societies, clubs and organizations. Diplomas, certificates of merit and various financial and legal documents are included as well. The collection contains fine examples of engravings, lithographs, and typography.
The collection is divided into 22 series and arranged alphabetically by subject:
I: Art
II: Business
III: Celebrations and Events
IV: Civic
V: Education
VI: Financial
VII: Foreign Language
VIII: Fraternal
IX: Genealogical
X: Historical
XI: Humanitarian
XII: Legal
XIII: Medical
XIV: Memorial
XV: Military
XVI: Political and Government
XVII: Regional and Ethnic
XVIII: Religious
XIX: Scientific
XX: Sports and Athletics
XXI: Trades
XXII: Transportation
Accruals
This collection is open to new acquisitions.
Related Materials
N-YHS holds other certificates which can be found within manuscript collections, as well as certificates that were cataloged individually as manuscripts.
Associations, institutions, etc Charities Fraternal organizations Schools -- United States Societies Typography Baptismal certificates Certificates. Engravings Lithographs. Marriage certificates Passports. Stock certificates
Series I: Art2264891816-1991
Scope Note
This series contains certificates of membership to museums and art related clubs and societies. Included are certificates of membership to the Allied Artists of America, the International Art-Union, NewYork Gallery of Fine Arts and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Also included is John McComb's 1816 membership certificate for the American Academy of Fine Arts; and a hand lettered certificate, given to Samuel T. Shaw by the Salmagundi Club, to commemorate the twenty-fifth anniversary of the Shaw Purchase Prize. Certificates from the National Academy of Design include those given to J. Carroll Beckwith, Asher B. Durand, and Helen M. Turner.American Academy of the Fine Arts2265241816-181721International Art Union226525184921Metropolitan Museum of Art2265261893, 194022National Academy of Design2285161841-1937FF1New-York Gallery of Fine Arts227228182722Salmagundi2285171928FF1Society of Iconophiles228426190522Certificates presented to the New-York Historical Society2284291943-199123Series II. Business2264901889-1942
Scope and Contents Note
This series includes certificates issued by or to business organizations. Included is a certificate from the NY State Office of the Secretary of State granting Strobridge Lithographers a license to do business in New York. One certificate of note is a certificate of membership to the Chamber of Commerce of the State of New York, given to General William T. Sherman in 1889. Another is a hand-lettered certificate presented to Edwin B. Moore upon his retirement from the New York Tribune. Of special interest is an 1893 certificate from Tiffany and Co. presented to Adalbert Emil Herrman Nordbrock upon completion of his apprenticeship in the silversmith department.American Society of Certified Public Accountants2275891922FF3New York City Mayor's Business Advisory Committee2285201942FF2NY State Chamber of Commerce2272311889-1899FF2NY State Office of the Secretary of State (business license)2285221893FF3Rice Leaders of the World Association2285211932FF3Tiffany and Company2272321893FF3Series III: Celebrations and Events2264911852-1955
Scope and Contents Note
This series contains certificates related to the planning, funding, and participation of a variety of expositions, fairs, events. Certificates include an invitation to the dedication ceremonies of the New York State Monument at Gettysburg in 1893, a blank certificate for the New England Sanitary Commission Fair in 1863, and a souvenir of the Civic & Industrial Parade, in New York City, 1889. Also included are certificates for the 1939 New York World's Fair and two certificates, designed and engraved by the Major & Knapp Co., for the United States Centennial Exhibition.
A beautifully detailed and hand-colored certificate created by the Ancient Order of Hibernians, thanking William Sulzer for his participation in their St. Patrick's Day Celebration in Albany, 1894.
Two certificates from the 1877 Agricultural Society of New South Wales' Metropolitan Intercolonial Exhibition awarded John Rogers bronze medals for his statuary.
Certificates given to J. Carroll Beckwith commemorate his participation in the Universal Exposition in St. Louis, the Exposition Universell of 1900, the First International Exposition of Modern Decorative Arts in Turin, and the Louisiana Purchase Exposition. Asher B. Durand's certificate for engraving from the 1876 International Exhibition in Philadelphia is included as well. Certificates from the American Institute Fair are heavily illustrated and engraved by the American Bank Note Company.
Of special note is an 1852 certificate issued by the Common Council of the City of New York announcing a public reception for Irish patriot Thomas Francis Meagher "in appreciation of his services in the cause of Civil Liberty." Scope and Contents Note
This series includes commendations, membership, and professional certificates. Most were issued by fire and police departments
One fire department certificate is a colorful lithograph printed by Currier and Ives. New York City Fire Department certificates include several engraved by Peter Maverick from a drawing by Archibald Robertson. Another certificate, a fireman's exemption from jury duty, has an 1829 ten cent piece attached. Other fire department certificates were isuued by Albany, Paterson, San Francisco, and Toledo departments.
Police department certificates include appointments to various positions in the New York City and Morrisania departments as well as a membership certificate to the Police Endowment Fund Association. One 1896 certificate is signed by Theodore Roosevelt, then president of New York's Board of Police Commissioners. Certificates given to policemen to commemorate cases they helped solve are hand-lettered and illustrated. One of these has an albumen portrait of Elmira, NY Police Chief Levi D. Little attached.
Membership certificates from the Committee of Vigilance of the City of San Francisco include several that once belonged to John Stoneacre Ellis. There is also a certificate heralding the appointment of Benjamin Crane to Superintendent of Central Park 1870.
Certificates honoring retiring or resigning workers are particularly beautiful. A certificate recording the resignation of fireman Zophar Mills includes an albumen photograph of a fire engine. Another, given to Colonel J. Mayhew Wainwright upon his resignation as the Commissioner of the Westchester County Park Commission, is hand-lettered in the style of an illuminated manuscript. Also included are certificates for Columbus Ryan, George Rivet Van Namee, and John W. Chambers. An albumen photograph of John Chambers is included on his certificate.Bronx Borough President2286631917FF59City of New York Department of Public Parks2320131870FF59Fire Departments-New York City-Manhattan 2265311778-188326-7Fire Departments-New York City-Manhattan2272521808-1914, undatedFF5-FF6Fire Departments-New York City-Manhattan2287721829-1893FF60Fire Departments-New York City-Manhattan1859, 1864Oversize FF 82Fire Departments-New York City-Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens2287681850-1901FF7Fire Departments-New York City-Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens2287691829-1903, undatedFF61Fire Departments-Cities other than New York2265321828-1858, undated28Fire Departments- Cities other than New York2276031851-1863, undatedFF62Police Departments-New York City 2265351851-192929Police Departments-New York City2272531866-1918FF8Police Departments-New York and other cities2276051879-1884FF63NY State Public Service Commission2285191943FF59San Francisco Committee of Vigilance2272351851, undatedFF9Westchester County Parks Commission2286671936FF59Series V: Education2264941802-1951
Scope and Contents Note
This series is comprised of certificates of merit, diplomas, and teaching certificates. The bulk of the merit certificates and grammar school diplomas came from public schools in New York City. Diplomas include those from Columbia University, Cooper Union, Eastman National Business College, Princeton University, Rutgers Female Institute, the University of Maine and Yale University. Many of these certificates were printed on parchment and have elaborate seals. Includes diplomas from a variety of colleges and universities.Other certificates include teacher certifications, course completion certificates for classes at Cooper Union, a certificate of apprenticeship from the New York State Board of Pharmacy, and membership certificates for the Free-School Society of New-York and the American University Popular Course of Home Reading. There are certificates to various clubs and organizations at Columbia University and Harvard University. 4 diplomas tracing Closs's education: New York City public school (P.S. 44 in Queens), 1910; Far Rockaway High School, 1914; College of New Rochelle, Sodality of the Blessed Virgin Mary, 1917; B.A., Curatore Collegii Novae Rupellae (College of New Rochelle), 1918.

Processed into collection January 2019 by archivist Larry Weimer.Library Membership Certificates2265451833, 187037Teaching Certificates2272711852-1895, undatedFF26Series VI: Financial2278911840-1941
Scope Note
This series contains bank notes, stocks and other financial documents. Bank notes include those for the Hungarian Fund and an uncut sheet of four bank notes from The Farmers Bank. New York stocks include stock in the Brooklyn Union Elevated Railroad, the Coney Island and Brooklyn Railroad Company, the New York Pier and Warehouse Company, the Brooklyn-Manhattan Transit Corporation and the Bennett Combined Automatic, and Manual Organ Company of New York. Many of these certificates are illustrated.
Other financial documents include Confederate States of America coupon bonds, used to raise capital for the war effort; a copy, probably printed as an advertisement, of a life insurance policy for Robert E. Lee, issued by the State Mutual Life Insurance Company; and bonds issued by the City of New Orleans.367th Infantry Auditorium Bond232745undated41Bennett Combined Automatic and Manual Organ Company Stock Certificate232752circa 188041Brooklyn-Manhattan Transit Corporation Stock Certificate2327661924-194142Brooklyn Union Elevated Railroad Stock Certificate232757189942Chicago, St. Paul and Fond du Lac Railroad Company Bond232747185741Coney Island and Brooklyn Railroad Company Stock Certificate232756190842Confederate States of America Bonds2326771863-1864FF27Facsimile of Bank of New York Warrant No. 1232687undatedFF27Farmer's Bank232715circa 184041Hungarian Fund232701185241LaCrosse Gold Mining Company of Colorado232722186641New England Protection Union Stock Certificate232727185241New Orleans City Bonds2326741862FF27New York Academy of Music Stock Certificate232738188541New York Pier and Warehouse Company Stock Certificate232759186642Peanut Club Bond232736188041Philadelphia City Bond232743187441Southern California Home Builders Stock Certificate232740191341State Mutual Life Insurance Company2272721906FF27United States of Freedom Bond2327611895-189642Water Stock/Water Loan of the City of New York Certificates232753circa 184042Series VII: Foreign Language 2278921852-1947
Scope Note
This series includes certificates in Arabic, Dutch, Danish, French, Greek, Latin, Polish, Spanish, Italian and German. The certificates have not been translated but include religious, academic, and honorary subjects.
Certificates in French are mainly honoring soldiers who served in World War I. One of these certificates of honor has the Chateau-Thierry Medal attached. The medal depicts the busts of Washington & Lafayette and the Legion of Honor on the reverse. A 1907 membership certificate records aviator Alan Hawley's membership in L'Aero-Club de France.Arabic232801undatedFF28Danish2328031929FF28Dutch 2328081852, undatedFF28French2327961907-1947FF29German233027undatedFF28Greek227273 undatedFF28Italian2327971871FF28Latin2328021878-1922, undatedFF28Polish2328041923-1937FF28Spanish2328101880, 1889FF28Series VIII: Fraternal2278931792-1937
Scope Note
This series includes certificates of membership to fraternal organizations and lodges including the Odd Fellows and the Freemasons. Freemason organizations represented include the Scottish Rite, the Police Square Club, and Knights Templar. Several certificates use the Masonic calendar, recording years in AL or AO. Many of these certificates are printed on parchment and have wax or embossed seals.
The collection includes several certificates of membership, given to John Stoneacre Ellis, to both California Freemason and Odd Fellow organizations. A colorful lithograph, titled "Masonic Chart" and printed by Strobridge & Co., contains religious and symbolic imagery. A memorial certificate for Benjamin S. Clark records his history with the masons and includes an albumen portrait.Ancient Arabic Order of the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine for North America [Shriners]2294681889, 190245Ancient Order of Druids2294731846FF30Elks Lodge22727518684 5Fraternal Order of Eagles229466190445Fraternity of Delta Psi/ St. Anthony Hall2294721882FF30Freemasons2265851808-193744Freemasons2294761853-1907FF30Freemasons2294851886FF65Independent Order of Odd Fellows226588183445Independent Order of Odd Fellows2294751844FF30Independent Order of Odd Fellows2294861858, 1864FF65Knights Templar2276091864, 189045Knights Templar2294741863FF30Mystic Order of Veiled Prophets of the Enchanted Realm229465191245Order of United Americans2294841848, undatedFF65Society of Black Friars2270481792-179545Series IX: Genealogical2278941785-1940
Scope Note
This series is comprised of membership certificates to organizations that base their membership on lineage. Societies include the Daughters of the American Revolution, the Society of Colonial Wars, the Society of Mayflower Descendants, the Saint Nicholas Society of the City of New York, the Society of California Pioneers, the Society of the Cincinnati and Sherwood Kindred of America. Scope Note
This series is comprised mainly of certificates of membership and acknowledgements of financial contributions to organizations focused on commemorating various aspects of American history.
Membership certificates include those to the American Antiquarian Society, the American Historical Association, the Massachusetts Historical Society, and the New-York Historical Society. New-York Historical Society membership certificates are illustrated with an image of the arrival of Henry Hudson, engraved by Asher B. Durand. Blank New-York Historical Society fellow and patron certificates include an original drawing of the certificate by its designer, E. D. French. Also included are certificates from the New Hampshire Historical Society, the American Flag House and Betsy Ross Memorial Association, and a number of presidential societies. The American Bank Note Company printed the certificates of membership for the Roosevelt Memorial Association and the Alexander Hamilton National Memorial Association.
Acknowledgements of contributions include those to the Washington National Monument, the Bunker Hill Monument Association, and the National Lincoln Monument in Illinois, as well as a certificate acknowledging a donation to provide a pedestal for the Statue of Liberty.American Antiquarian Society2297531940FF39American Committee on the Statue of Liberty2297151883FF34American Flag House and Betsy Ross Memorial Association2266541889-191351American Historical Association 2297541930FF41American Scenic and Historic Preservation Society2273281912FF41Alexander Hamilton National Memorial Association2297661903FF42Bunker Hill Monument Association226655circa 182352Ulysses S. Grant Monument Association2273321897FF34Hoboken Soldiers Monument Association229716undatedFF34Abraham Lincoln Societies2266571869-192853New-York Historical Society 2273351846-1974, undatedFF35-FF38
Scope and Contents
Additional membership certificates from N-YHS can be found in the institutional archive: New-York Historical Society membership records (NYHS-RG 9).Roosevelt Memorial Association229764circa 1920FF34Society for the Preservation of Antique Motor Fire Apparatus in America2297551980FF39Soldier's Monument Park Association of Schuylkill County229717circa 1887FF34George Washington Societies2266581923-1938, undated54Roger Williams Monument Association229714circa 1860FF34Woodrow Wilson Foundation229765circa 1922FF34Series XI: Humanitarian2278981700-1885
Scope Note
This series contains membership certificates for the New York Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children, the Woman's Central Association of Relief, Cape Palmas Female Orphan Asylum Society, the Lawrence Benevolent Institution of Pennsylvania, the U.S. Sanitary Commission, the New-Jersey Society for Promoting the Abolition of Slavery.
Certificates for the New York Marine Society, a group formed to provide assistance to widows and children of deceased sailors, include both reproductions and originals with wax seals. There are also certificates from other maritime organizations that provided assistance to sailors and their families.
Of special interest is a certificate for completion of an apprenticeship at the New York House of Refuge, circa 1870.American Female Guardian Society and Home for the Friendless229800185755American Seamen's Friend Society2298191848, undatedFF36American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals2298061885FF35Benevolent Institution of Pennsylvania2298071825FF35Brooklyn and Long Island Sanitary Fair2298101864FF35Cape Palmas Female Orphan Asylum Society2298091854FF35New Jersey Society for Promoting the Abolition of Slavery229801undated55New York House of Refuge229811circa 1870FF35New York Marine Society2266691700-186256New York Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children2298021876, 187955Newport Marine Society229820undatedFF36Provident Society of the State of New York226668180755Sandy Hook Pilot's Charitable Fund2298211855FF36Womans Central Association for Relief229803186655Series XII: Legal2278991809-1936
Scope Note
This series includes birth, marriage and death certificates, passports, and certificates of admission to the bar. Some are on parchment and include wax or foil seals. Also included are leases, receipts, a deed for land in the Dakota Territories, and a certificate from the London Trade Marks Registry Office.
Of special interest is an ornate lithograph recording the marriage of Henry Lockwood and Zana Rowland in 1885. Cartes de visite of the bride and groom are attached to the verso.
Also of note is a hand-lettered document from the State of New York Executive Chamber. The certificate, created in 1913, is affixed with the pen that was used to sign a bill regarding the Highway Act into law. Scope Note
This series contains certificates related to the medical profession, including diplomas from medical schools, certificates of membership in medical societies, and registrations to practice medicine.
Certificates from the American National Red Cross include two given to James Hazen Hyde in 1918 and 1919, for services rendered during World War I.
Certificates of membership from the Society of the New York Hospital are made out to John McComb, John McComb Jr., and James W. Gift of David Doss, August 2018 (PPAC.2018.042)Medical Associations-New York Medico Legal Society2302531872FF42Medical Associations-Sons and Daughters of Hygiea, State of Massachusetts230246circa 1900FF42Medical Associations-Steuben County Medical Society2302491821FF42Series XIV: Memorial2279021872-1931
Scope Note
This series is comprised of certificates from clubs and organizations honoring deceased members. These include certificates in memory of William de Groot from the Empire State Society, James C. Russell from the Coffee Exchange of the City of New York, and Edward L. Phalon from the John Bruning Bowling Club.
Two certificates were printed to honor fallen Civil War soldiers, including one printed by Currier and Ives. Also included are certificates in memory of James P. Harper and John McEntee Bowman.
Of special note is a memorial for Horace Greeley from the American Institute. This certificate is elaborately hand-lettered and includes an albumen portrait.Coffee Exchange of the City of New York2305701913FF43Farmer's Club of the American Institute2305831872FF73German American Society2305851873FF73Hotel Association of New York City2305791931FF43John Bruning Bowling Club230573undatedFF43Lexington Avenue Church230578undatedFF43Sons of the American Revolution2273851899FF43Veteran Corps2305811873FF43Series XV: Military2279041838-1946
Scope Note
This series includes certificates given to commemorate appointments and changes in rank, citations and discharges from service, as well as membership to various clubs and organizations. It also includes certificates of recognition for donation of time or funds to various military causes. Some are printed on parchment with original seals.
Certificates of appointment include several from both John Stoneacre Ellis and Jonathan Mayhew Wainwright. One certificate from Hempstead, Long Island dated 1819, acknowledges a soldiers enrollment in "a troop of horse artillery…comprising part of a brigade in the second regiment of the state of New York."
A War Department certificate confirms pension payments owed to Revolutionary War widow Esther Hammond.
Certificates of discharge include one for Fred W. Mather, member of the 24th Regiment, United Stated Colored Troops.
Also included are several Civil War Soldiers Memorial certificates, which list names and ranks of regiment soldiers as well as their battle history.Appointments- Army 2314981921-192672Appointments- Army 2315011866-1868, 1892, 1911FF44Appointments- National Army Draft Board226843191772Appointments- National Guard2273911857-1920FF45Appointments- Officers' Reserve Corps231497192172Appointments- San Francisco City Guard231505undatedFF44Appointments- United States Merchant Marines2318301919FF44Appointments- First California Guard2315021850-1861FF44Appointments- Second Brigade of the Militia of the State of California2318381862FF74Appointments- Second Irish Regiment, California Militia2315031864FF44Appointments- Second Regiment of New York State2318281819FF44Appointments- 12th Regiment of New York Volunteers2315191898FF44Appointments- 66th Regiment of New York Volunteers231500186172Appointments- 29th Regiment of Pennsylvania Volunteers2314991862, undated72Citations- Albany Burgesses Corps, commemoration of the excursion to Newburgh2318901867FF74Citations- American Expeditonary Forces Citation for Meritorious Service2315591918-1919FF46Citations- Army Ordnance Association Medal of Merit2315721937FF46Citations- Belgian "Croix de Guerre Belge" for Meritorious Service in Ypres2315761921FF46Citations- British War Mission2318501918FF46Citations- Commonwealth of Massachusetts Testimonial of Gratitude for Patriotism2315641870FF46Citations- County of Richmond (S.I.) Political and Government2279051805-1994
Scope Note
This series is comprised of certificates from various government and political organizations.
Two certificates of appointment to federal positions have President Warren Harding's signature.
Tammany Society (also known as the Columbian Order) certificates contain one printed by Samuel Maverick and two that are illustrated and hand-lettered. Certificates of membership to the Tippecanoe Club are printed with images of William Henry Harrison.
One certificate of note was issued to Elisha Harris in recognition of his efforts to conduct the first sanitary survey of the city to try to combat cholera.Government-Federal- appointment to Aide in the Inaguration Parade2320791901FF48Government-Federal- appointment to Assistant Secretary of War2320751921FF48Government-Federal- appointment to Pension Agent2320101886FF48Government-Federal- appointment to the Advisory Committee at the Conference of Limitation of Armanent2320881921FF48Government-Federal- appointment to the War Industries Board2320871918FF48Government-Local- City of New York- appointment of Comptroller2320511934FF49Government-Local- City of New York- appointment to committee for the commemoration of NYC's golden jubilee2320621948FF49Government-Local- City of New York- Common Council 2274011851, 1878FF49Government-Local- City of New York- Common Council 1861, 1863Oversize FF 82Government - Local - City of New York - Accumulated Debt Bond1869, 1879FF49

Scope Note
This series contains certificates of membership to societies with regional and/or ethnic interests. Certificates include the Caledonian Society of the City of New York, the Society of St. George and the South Carolina Society. The German Society certificate is written in German and has its original wax seal.
Certificates of membership in the Cape Cod Association lithographs by Sarony, Major and Knapp and are heavily illustrated with maritime images as well as views of Provincetown, Massachusetts.
Also of note is John Stoneacre Ellis' certificate of membership to the Associated Pioneers of the Territorial Days of California. Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Frederick Baker, 2018.Herkimer County Historical Society232229191091Hispanic Society of America2322341907FF79Massachusetts Historical Society2322401930FF79New Hampshire Historical Society232231192791New York Southern Society232219undated91Society of St. George232216undated91South Carolina Society232222undated91Ticonderoga Historical Society232227191091Upper Missouri Historical Expedition2322381925FF79Series XVIII: Religious2279071809-1929
Scope Note
This series includes certificates of baptism, communion and confirmation, as well as membership to various religious societies. Sunday school attendance and merit certificates are also part of this series.
One certificate from the American Bible Union records contributions made to the group to distribute bibles to "the Freedmen of America." A group of ephemera related to the Domestic Missionary Army of the Young Soldiers of Christ of the Protestant Episcopal Church includes a ribbon printed with the portrait of Jackson Kemper. Temperance certificates include membership to the Boston Temperance Society, the Washington Temperance Society, and several Juvenile Temperance Societies. One particularly interesting certificate is a certificate of membership for the Connecticut Cold Water Army, which includes songs of the Cold Water Army. Early membership certificates for the American Bible Society include those for Mrs. John McComb, Jr. and Gerard Beekman.
Related Materials
N-YHS also holds about 70 marriage (mostly), baptism, confirmation, and death certificates in the Jon Charles Acker collection of religious certificates (PR 360).Bible and Tract Societies- American Society232454184296Series XIX: Scientific2279081819-1945
Scope Note
This series contains certificates of membership to societies such as the American Association for the Advancement of Science, the National Geographic Society, the New York Academy of Science, and the New York Zoological Society.
Award certificates from various environmental, agricultural, and horticultural societies include an award for "a superior market wagon" from the Queens County Agricultural Society, and "best 12 ears of sweet corn" from the Horticultural Society of Morrisania.
A certificate of membership in the Audubon Society is embellished with an engraved portrait of Audubon as well as a small image of Cedar Birds.
A hand-lettered certificate by Tiffany and Co. from the American Numismatic and Archaeological Society commemorates the retirement of Daniel Parish, Jr. Tiffany and Co. also designed the membership certificates for the American Museum of Natural History.
Also of note are certificates from The Literary and Philosophical Society, a scientific society founded by DeWitt Clinton and Samuel Latham Mitchell in New York in 1814, and dissolved 1834.Amateur Astronomers Association232533194797American Association for the Advancement of Science2325311887-191397American Forestry Association2325491927910American Geographical and Statistical Society2325351856FF80American Institute2272301856, 1885FF80American Museum of Natural History2275601895, 1918-1939FF80American Numismatic and Archaeological Society2325341896FF80Aquidneck Agricultural Society of Newport, Rhode Island232541188198Association for the Protection of the Adirondacks2325481902910Astronomical Society of Michigan232536undatedFF80Audubon Society227065188799Federation of the Bird Clubs of New England232546192699Franklin Institute232530193897Horticultural Society of Morrisania232547undated910Horticultural Society of New Haven2325501846910Laboratory of Anthropology227060194597Literary and Philosophical Society of New York2328371822, undatedFF80Massachusetts Kennel Club232544188299Montgomery County Agricultural Society232540circa 184098National Geographic Society2270611907-1936911New Jersey Association of Poultry, Pigeon and Pet Stock Fanciers232543192299New York Academy of Sciences232532189597New York Zoological Society2270661911-1916912Patrons of Husbandry2325511896FF80Queens County Agricultural Society232542184998Society for the Promoting Agriculture and Domestic Manufactures2325391819-182298Westminster Kennel Club, New York232545187999Series XX: Sports and Athletics2279111800-1933
Scope Note
This series includes certificates of membership to the Amateur Athletic Union of the United States and the New York Sadlers' Society. Also included is a certificate qualifying Louis Senar as an instructor in the art of fencing from the Amateur Fencers League of America.Amateur Fencers League226627undated913American Athletic Union2271221887, 1933913New-York Sadler's Society232553circa 1800913Series XXI: Trades2279131795-1939
Scope Note
This series includes certificates of membership to professional societies, as well as one certificate of recognition from the Building Trades Employers' Association.
Three early certificates are found in this series. One, a membership certificate for the New York Coopers Society dated 1827, is illustrated with an engraving of men working along a harbor. Another, from the Society of Master Sail Makers of the City of New York dated 1795, is illustrated with several vignettes showing sail making, ship building and harbor scenes and has its original wax seal. The third, dated 1825 and printed by Peter Maverick, was given to Sarah Daniels for her "meritorious services" by the Society for the Encouragement of Fathful Domestic Servants.
A certificate awarded to John Rogers for his statuary groups from the Massachusetts Charitable Mechanic Association is included. Certificates of membership in the General Society of Mechanics and Tradesmen, printed by Maverick, include those of John McComb and John Snook. Also included is a lithograph for the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers printed by the Strobridge Lithographing Company.American Society of Civil Engineers2325791899FF53Brotherhood of Local Engineers2328321884FF81Building Trades Employers' Association2275621904FF53General Society of Mechanics and Tradesmen2275711791-1878, undatedFF54Institution of Radio Engineers Australia2325711939FF53Massachusetts Charitable Mechanic Association2325841874, 1881FF53Mechanics Institute of the City of New York2325761853FF53Mechanics Mutual Protections2325731848FF53Merchant's Association of New York2275721908-1928FF55New York Building Congress232581undatedFF53New York Coopers Society2325641827FF53Society of Master Sail-Makers of the City of New York2325691795FF53Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers2325721893FF53Society for the Encouragement of Faithful Domestic Servants2330161825FF53Series XXII: Transportation2279141851-1985
Scope Note
This series contains certificates of membership and commemoration; licenses; and invitations related to ship, steamboat, and railroad transport.
One certificate of membership records dues paid to the New York Cheap Transportation Association. Two licenses are included; one to operate motor boats carrying passengers for hire, the other to operate ocean or coastwise steam and motor vessels.
Two certificates commemorate the opening of the New York and Erie Rail Road. An invitation to attend the ceremony of opening the Holland Tunnel is also included in this series.
Another certificate is a resolution passed by the Central Park, North and East River Railroad Company thanking police officials for their assistance during a strike.
Also of interest are two certificates of inspection for the steamers New York and Daniel Drew.Central Park, North and East River Railroad Company2326231889FF56Certificate of Inspection for Passenger Steamers2326141876, 1892FF56Panama-Pacific International Exposition2326421985FF56New York Cheap Transportation Association2266291874FF56New York and Erie Railroad Company2271591851FF56New York State Bridge and Tunnel Commission2326441927FF56United States Department of Commerce2326481940-1941FF56
